title: Freelance Consultant
context: Join Green Orbit Digital as a Freelance Consultant and contribute to high-impact digital marketing and sustainability projects for space and climate-tech clients. You’ll work across strategy, campaign optimisation, and consulting, applying your expertise to help organisations achieve measurable, responsible growth.
description: We are seeking a proactive Freelance Consultant with strong expertise in digital marketing, sustainability, and the space sector. You will advise clients, develop and execute strategic campaigns, and deliver actionable insights that drive tangible impact. This role offers flexibility, autonomy, and the opportunity to work with a purpose-driven team.
personSpec: The ideal candidate has 2+ years of consulting experience with proven skills in project management, SEO, and sustainability strategy. You should be confident working independently, managing client expectations, and delivering high-quality results. Excellent communication, analytical thinking, and problem-solving skills are essential.
perks: Competitive day rate, fully flexible working schedule, access to professional development resources including industry webinars and workshops, opportunity to work with leading organisations in space and sustainability, and a supportive collaborative team environment.
process:
Stage 1: CV Review
Stage 2: Short Interview
Stage 3: Project Assessment
responsibilities: Advise clients on digital marketing and sustainability strategy
Plan, execute, and optimise campaigns for measurable impact
Provide detailed reporting and actionable recommendations
Collaborate with internal teams and stakeholders as needed
requirements: Proven track record in digital marketing and sustainability
Ability to work independently and flexibly
preferredQualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Sustainability, or related field
CIM (Chartered Institute of Marketing) qualification or equivalent
Professional certification in Project Management (e.g., PRINCE2, PMP)
Experience with high-impact sustainability or space-tech projects

title: Personal Assistant
context: Be a key part of Green Orbit Digital’s leadership team as a Personal Assistant, coordinating projects, schedules, and communications. Your support ensures smooth operations across a fast-paced, mission-driven organisation focused on sustainable digital growth.
description: We are looking for an organised and proactive Personal Assistant to support the leadership team. You will manage calendars, coordinate internal and external communications, assist with project delivery, and help ensure the office and remote operations run efficiently. This role is perfect for someone who thrives in dynamic, collaborative environments.
personSpec: You have excellent organisational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to prioritise competing tasks. Strong communication skills, discretion, and professionalism are essential. Previous experience as a PA or in an administrative role is highly desirable. You should be comfortable managing schedules, liaising with stakeholders, and supporting multiple projects simultaneously.
perks: Competitive salary, flexible working arrangements including remote options, pension and health benefits, opportunities for professional development, and the chance to contribute directly to meaningful sustainability-focused projects.
process:
Stage 1: CV Review
Stage 2: Video Interview
Stage 3: In-Person Interview (optional)
responsibilities: Manage calendars and schedules for leadership team
Support project coordination and ensure timely delivery
requirements: 1+ year of PA or administrative experience
preferredQualifications: Degree or diploma in Business Administration, Management, or related field
Professional qualification in office administration or executive support
Experience supporting leadership teams in fast-paced environments
Familiarity with project management or CRM tools (e.g., Asana, HubSpot)

title: Intern
context: Kickstart your career in sustainable digital marketing and content creation at Green Orbit Digital. Learn hands-on skills while supporting projects that create real-world impact across the space and sustainability sectors.
description: As an Intern, you will assist with client campaigns, research, content creation, and social media management. This is an opportunity to gain practical experience, learn from experienced professionals, and develop the skills needed for a future career in digital marketing and sustainability.
personSpec: We are looking for motivated, curious, and proactive individuals with an interest in research, content creation, and social media. No prior professional experience is required, but enthusiasm, a willingness to learn, and strong communication skills are essential.
perks: Flexible remote working, mentorship and guidance from experienced team members, practical industry experience across multiple projects, exposure to sustainable marketing practices, and career development support.
process:
Stage 1: CV and Cover Letter Submission
Stage 2: Short Interview
Stage 3: Internship Offer
responsibilities: Assist in content creation and social media campaigns
Conduct research and support marketing initiatives
Learn and apply industry best practices
requirements: Interest in digital marketing, sustainability, and content creation
preferredQualifications: Currently enrolled in or recently graduated from a degree program in Marketing, Communications, Sustainability, or related field
CIM student membership or equivalent marketing/communications coursework
Experience or coursework in content creation, social media, or digital analytics
Familiarity with research and data analysis techniques
